intro: Apodiscus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plants typically have showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pink petals. Apodiscus species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens. They prefer well-drained soil and full sun, making them suitable for Mediterranean climates.
